Although deaths from breast cancer continue to fall, they’re declining at a slower rate than in previous years, & the number of cases is rising. It is very important that we take this valuable opportunity to talk about this dreaded disease & increase our knowledge on the topic.

HHS announced last week that AL will receive $6.3m to help combat the opioid crisis that's gripping communities throughout AL. This money will help community health centers & schools improve access to treatment, services, & education. More via @yhn here: https://t.co/pZjgcDed6c

In Central AL, there have been times a veteran has sought out mental health care, received no follow-up, & it resulted in suicide. We have a real problem in some of our VA health care systems. We have failed our veterans time & time again. Now, 20 of them are giving up each day.

According to the VA’s own data, the Central AL VA continues to be a terrible VA health care system. I am sick & tired of getting status quo answers as to why. This is a huge disservice to our veterans, & I will not stop making the case to Secretary Wilkie until we get this right.

In order to actually combat gun violence, we must take a long, hard look at making improvements in our society, like repairing our mental health care system & enforcing existing laws. We must stop playing politics w/ legislation that will not benefit the American people.
